channel.title: Tanner Lake on tlake.io
channel.description: Recent content in Tanner Lake on tlake.io

item.title: The Thoroughbred of Sin
item.description: The battle with the followers of Malar continues as an ominous, red storm assaults the sky. Finally, the Pool of Eternal Spring is located, only moments too late. The corrupted avatar of Lurue has been summoned.

item.title: Serving the Narrative
item.description: Finn revisits her fascination with wells, a hag has a few dryads over for dinner, and the party is pulled along the echoes of Gray’s earlier vision.

item.title: An Immersive Tale
item.description: Now with direct access to the libraries of Candlekeep, the party continues their research before Gimble finds a suspicious, enchanted book, and they find strange things within.

item.title: The Walk Without Shame
item.description: The party continues processing the results of their research requests, an unsteady Gimble has some troubling revelations at the Temple of Oghma, and Oneshoe enthusiastically takes one for the team. Just as the party considers leaving to find Nyx, they are granted access to The Emerald Door and the interior of Candlekeep.

item.title: Feldmar Bisset III
item.description: Description Appearance Human male Personality Biography Owner and proprietor of the family-run Erudite Outfitters and Clothiers workshop in Candlekeep. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Gruumsh
item.description: Description Orc god of war, conquest, and destruction. Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Jarvis III
item.description: Description Appearance A grizzled old human male. Personality Biography A patron at the Elfsong Tavern in Baldur’s Gate. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Kei Tigersteel
item.description: Description Appearance Human female Personality Biography Lorekeeper Kei Tigersteel is the caretake of the temple of Oghma at Candlekeep. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.description: Description Appearance A human female Personality Biography A guard at the Basilisk Gate in Baldur’s Gate. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Sleeping Giant Inn
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: The Revenant
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: The Wolves
item.description: Description An organization of operatives from Gray’s past, ostensibly headquartered on an island called Marea. Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Tresendar Manor
item.description: The collective home of the Menagerie, located in Phandalin. Map Key Info

item.title: Research Obstructing Research
item.description: Gimble’s contact other plane goes a little off the rails, and he has a conversation with Gruumsh. The group try to come up with a new plan for dealing with Nyx’s pursuers, since their charade in Baldur’s Gate failed to pull them off of Nyx’s trail. Val tours the Court of Air looking for any possible way to get past the Emerald Door. Cassandra visits, and the first round of requested knowledge is delievered.

item.title: Tasha
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography AKA: Iggwilv Zybilna Tasha Natasha The Witch-Queen Ruler of the domain of delight known as Prismeer. Creator of the Demonomicon. Consort/prisoner/master of Graz’zt. Adopted daughter of Baba Yaga.

item.title: Wallace
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography A scribe in the House of the Binder at Candlekeep. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Arrival in Candlekeep
item.description: The party gains entry into Candlekeep and its outer Court of Air, but they are barred investigating the inner library themselves, despite Gimble’s insistence. Instead, they fill out numerous research requests and seek lodging to rest and prepare for what comes next.

item.title: Harriet
item.description: Description Appearance A very human-looking female tiefling. Personality Kinda weird, tbh, not overly burdened with understanding social cues. Biography One of the lower-level assistants of the Avowed in Candlekeep. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Jay the Clerk
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography One of the clerks who manage the front desk of the House of Rest at Candlekeep. (The other one is a very quiet Robert.) Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Kalan Strongbranch
item.description: Description Appearance An older human male. Personality Biography A keeper of the outer gate at Candlekeep. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Can I Get a Receipt?
item.description: Gimble fails to scry upon his pursuer, yet the party pushes on and teleports to Baldur’s Gate, where they make some noise about researching The Shard of Mystra. Horns enhances his wildshape ability, and Zed continues to evangelize the way of yoga. After the brief stop, they wind walk the remainder of their journey, alighting just outside the fortress of Candlekeep.

item.title: A Study in Synthwave
item.description: Psithyron displays his latest masterpiece. Gray opens up more about his family. A desperate message from Finn is foreseen, and a gnome returns. The party considers their options, and a bold, but likely foolish plan is made.

item.title: On Traveling
item.description: Neverwinter -> Chult Calculations By Sea Distance from Neverwinter to the southern tip of the Tethyr Peninsula, following the coast as a ship would: ‚âà 1600 miles. On this map it’s roughly 16 hexes from the southern tip of the Tethyr Peninsula to Port Nyanzaru as a ship would sail, cutting along the west side of the eastern islands south of the peninsula.

item.title: Brooke
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Brooke Brooke became the proprietor of The Sleeping Giant in Phandalin after The Redbrands were run out of town. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Gray states the Brooke is a secret member of The Wolves.

item.title: Mea Culpa
item.description: The dust has barely settled from the battle with The Revenant, yet the party quickly goes their separate ways. Val takes a weary Gundren out for drinks; Oneshoe tails Finn as she is pulled into a suspicious conversation with Brooke; Horns assesses the damage to his room; and Gray has a vision in the basement. The party finally comes together again the next afternoon, and Gray admits to the group: this has all been his fault, and he needs to leave. A great amount of discord follows. Help is sought from absent allies with unclear results. The party fights about direction but fails to reach any consensus.

item.title: Vengeance Denied
item.description: Things look dire for most of the party. Then a certain half-orc shows up with some friends, and Horns removes the dragon from play. The tide turns.

item.title: Burying His Mum's Hatchet
item.description: The revenant has finally located Val, but she stays maddeningly just out of his reach. The burning rage must find a new outlet: her friends.

item.title: A Terrible Anniversary
item.description: At long last, Val’s relentless pursuer has found her. This time, the revenant brings an undead horde to exact his vengeance, or to destroy anything that would get in his way doing so.

item.title: A Family Meeting
item.description: The Menagerie take stock of the paths before them and spend a lot of time trying to choose one. Gray has an extensive (drunken) duel with a training dummy, and some familiar unfamiliar guests come calling in the night.

item.title: Levistus
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Paper Crane Letter to Gray
item.description: I pray the missive I received was a cruel joke by some nameless charlatan, for I had thought my mourning finished. I pray this letter finds no home, but drifts upon the wind, forever undelivered.

item.title: Ravio
item.description: Description Appearance A sleek, black, short-furred wild housecat with orange glassy eyes. Personality Possessed of a bored affectation, languid demeanor, and imperious personality. Biography Key Info The stray cat that “owns” the party’s home of Tresendar Manor.

item.title: Homecoming
item.description: OneShoe launches a personal investigation. Gray traumatizes a friend. Horns takes the party on the tree express train to Phandalin. Ravio delivers some news, and the Menagerie discover a lot of art in their home.

item.title: A Morally Gray Choice
item.description: Zed throws a Bullwinkle-sized wrench into Gray’s perilous reunion with a dangerous associate. Gray makes a tough choice, and the unshakable rider falls from his saddle.

item.title: Innocence
item.description: Description A female exotic dancer at Jefferson’s bar. Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Interlude: Oneshoe and Rinn'thalas
item.description: OneShoe spends a lot of money in the downtime period, and some out-of-character discussion is had.

item.title: Jefferson
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Mage-College
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Oneshoes-Detective-Agency
item.description: Description Chad, Sydney, and Harold Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Orson-Aegis
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Purity
item.description: Description A female tiefling studying infernals at the Mage’s College in Neverwinter. Had a one-night stand with Horns before the party went to Baator for Horns’ court summons. Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: The-Jade-Arbor
item.description: Map Key Info AKA “The Heartree”

item.title: Enabling HSTS for NginX and Traefik
item.description: So, I have a small hodgepodge of a home lab consisting of my primary desktop PC (“artemicion”), an Udoo Bolt (“bolt”), and a Raspberry PI 4 (“mansionsyrup”). I’ve got them networked together in a Docker swarm, with mansionsyrup as the leader.

item.title: Master Elian Amaadon
item.description: Master Elian Amaadon A powerful wizard and senior instructor of the Mage College in Neverwinter. Description Appearance Personality Displays earned confidence with a proper bearing. Shows patience and care for his students, even the wild ones.

item.title: Mission: Possible
item.description: The party spends some time in some of Neverwinter’s most popular locations, such as the burned and flooded marina district, the ever-popular Jefferson’s place (I forgot the name again), the Mage’s College, and a long-abandoned farmstead a couple miles north of the city.

item.title: Gregor
item.description: Description Gregor is a member of The Vigil and resides on Sigil. Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Gregor answered the call when Rinn’thalas sent and urgent message using his Amulet of the Vigil in 2022-08-03 Import Campaign.

item.title: Unidius
item.description: Description Basically a more violent, paranoid, D&D version of Mad-Eye Moody. Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships The Vigil Unidius is occasionally (though perhaps reluctantly) used by The Vigil as a contact/operative in Neverwinter.

item.title: Streaming to Discord on Linux: Managing audio streams via PulseAudio
item.description: As it turns out, streaming game audio to Discord isn’t trivial when you’re on Linux. The Problem It seems like Discord’s “Go Live” feature, which allows streaming both application audio and application video in addition to voice chat, doesn’t really exist on Linux?

item.title: Midwinter in Highsun
item.description: Val recovers from her possession by Graz’zt, Finn finds religion, and it snows in Neverwinter.

item.title: Val's Abyssal Note
item.description: I’ve fought through the haze for what I fear will be the last time. I hope there remain moments enough to draft this warning and to scatter it far enough beyond my reach.
Val continues to terrorize Neverwinter as she fights for agency from a demon prince, gets attacked by some kind of D&D version of Mad-Eye Moody, and is seemingly stabbed to death by Gray!

item.title: Trynna Briegarden
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia
A Graz’zt-influenced Val continues her rage across Neverwinter, and the party desparately tries to make sense of what is happening.
Finally back in Neverwinter, Graz’zt seizes control of Val and starts to rampage across the city.
Now that Horns has been exonerated, the party prepares to leave the Hells, but a certain demon prince has other plans.
Scaena et Tempore Synopsis Dramatis Personae The Party Returning New Mentioned Quotations Inventory Trivia
Content Placeholder

Scaena et Tempore Summary The party’s escape from the tower stalls with the realization that they are unable to teleport all of their summoned creatures to safety. Knowing Fierna could locate them any moment, some hard decisions are made at the expense of Zed’s minotaur friends, and the Menagerie finally teleports away.

Scaena et Tempore Summary Having dispatched the remaining guards in the corridor, the party resumes its search for Magrin. They find a room with six pillars, adorned with piles of teeth–apparently some ghastly connection to Gelfondi’s machine room found earlier.

Scaena et Tempore Summary Alone and defiant, Finn squares up against the incoming bone devil and its guard. She is swiftly restrained by a chain devil, and Finn summons her signature flumphs in retribution, but this does not stop the bone devil from savagely attacking Finn with its claws and hideous stinger.

Scaena et Tempore Summary The party carefully creeps along the southern corridor towards the west, hoping to avoid further detection. At the sight of a bone devil ahead, Zed and his minotaurs instead choose to (somehow) squeeze into a small alcove towards the center of the tower, where they uncover two hidden imps keeping watch.

item.title: Gelfondi
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Gelfondi The devil in charge of the operations on the 42nd floor of Fierna’s tower. Description Appearance Gelfondi is a horned devil, slightly shorter than usual. He was wearing some type or robes when the party surprised him in 2022-02-02 Import Campaign.

Scaena et Tempore Summary The party desperately tries to dispatch the the two horned devils and subordinate in the main corridor before the devils can alert the guard barracks and the rest of the tower.

item.title: Clear Wind
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Clear Wind A tabaxi bartender at the Moonlight All-Night Diner in Shadow Leilon. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Val Val is chatty with Clear Wind and calls her “Water Wendy”.

item.title: Denariel
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Denariel A sorceress and leader of a large contingent of drow in Shadow Leilon. Description Appearance A female drow. Personality Biography Key Info Denariel desires to take over as mayor of Shadow Leilon.

item.title: Elirion'tar
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Elirion’tar Brother to Val and was found working on a ship docked in Neverwinter. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Said he was on way to Chult and said the party could meet him later.

item.title: Aeortis
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Aeortis An apparent young girl who designed much Fierna’s tower. Description Appearance a (supposed) young girl, accompanied by three hellhounds Personality Biography Relationships Oneshoe In payment for giving information to the party, Aeortis required the party to perform a service for her and retrieve a particular soul coin from Fierna’s tower.

item.title: Belial
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Belial Belial is the lord of Phlegethos, who jointly rules the fourth layer together with his daughter Fierna. This unusual partnership was allowed by Asmodeus as an exception to the usual requirement of one ruler per layer.

item.title: Caerwyn Cadogan
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Caerwyn Cadogan A tuathan from the Feywild–once friend and a guide to the realm, now enemy after his betrayal at the Court of Stars. Description Appearance A handsome, anthromorphic fox.

item.title: Carmen
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Carmen Known as one of the most powerful and effective lawyers in Phlegethos. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Due to her extraordinary reputation, Carmen commands exceedingly high fees for her services.

item.title: Fierna
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Fierna Daughter of Belial, with whom she co-rules Phlegethos. Description Appearance Personality Described as fiery and even recklessly passionate. Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Gundren Rockseeker
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Gundren Rockseeker Gundren Rockseeker was one of the three dwarf brothers who rediscovered Wave Echo Cave. Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships Late Brothers brother to Tharden Rockseeker older brother to Nundro Rockseeker Val Gundren and Val become fast friends and drinking buddies.

item.title: Iarno Albrek
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Iarno Albrek human wizard, secret leader of The Redbrands under the name Glasstaff. Description Appearnce Personality Biography Key Info Previously a member of the Lord’s Alliance. Secretly the leader of The Redbrands.

item.title: Ignaroz
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Ignaroz Assistant to Carmen (?) who facilitates creation and administration of Tymphal’s Contract with the The Menagerie. Description Appearance First Meeting the Party a female spined devil, with white spines.

item.title: Keith Stone
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Keith Stone Stone Giant that provides hospitality for the party on the Road of Cinders. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Magrin
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Magrin A duergar who serves served as a chief manager of Tymphal’s operations. Description Appearance Initial Meeting in the Torture Room at Fierna’s Tower a now frail and despondent duergar, heavily beaten and lacking teeth After Tymphal’s Punishment Magrin’s essence is now confined within a green steel shield.

item.title: Melkor
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Melkor Contact that used to work at the tower Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Nyx
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Nyx Gimble’s older sister, a rock gnome who is also gifted in Divination. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Growing up, Gimble was told he was an only child.

item.title: Oberon
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Oberon Oberon, Lord of Beasts, consort of Queen Titania, and member of the Seelie Court. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Incensed by the assassination attempt on Queen Titania that left her comatose, Oberon has been leading an unending form of The Wild Hunt.

item.title: Psithyron
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Psithyron An imp which still remains in the service of Horns, back from when Horns was a general of Hell. Description Appearance Personality Impish. Biography Key Info Early on in the campaign, Psithyron manifested as a small, devilish figure that Horns had with him when he washed ashore on the beach and Reidoth found him.

item.title: Queen Titania
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Queen Titania Archfey and queen of the Summer Court of the Feywild. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info While the party visited the Court of Stars, they witnessed an assassination attempt on Queen Titania which left her gravely injured.

item.title: Quilnorae
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Quilnorae Reportedly an elvish paladin whose soul ended up in a Soul Coin in Fierna’s tower. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Aeortis issues a quest for Oneshoe to retrieve the coin with the soul of Quilnorae.

item.title: Tymphal
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Tymphal A duke of Phlegethos, Tymphal was a mechanical master smith whose lesser devil legions and hundreds of duergar slaves toiled in a volcano forge to produce weapons and infernal constructs.

item.title: Veshvor
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Veshvor A patron of The Brimstone who crossed Magnanimy. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Veshvor won a special necklace from Magnanimy. Magnanimy took offense to Veshvor’s behavior and asked Rinn’thalas to secure the return of the necklace in exchange for some information.

item.title: Waybert Spinzig
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Waybert Spinzig A gnome researcher who arrived in Phandalin along with Zilry to study the incoming Modron March. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Zilry Zilry is a companion who joins in Wayberts’s study.

item.title: Wrath the Chain Devil
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Wrath the Chain Devil A powerful chain devil who reportedly may know something about the whereabouts of Ze’brak. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Magnanimy claimed that Ze’brak may have drawn the ire of Wrath.

item.title: Zarinor
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Zarinor A white dragon, found bound in chains on the 42nd-floor during the Caper at Fierna’s Tower. Description Appearance Large-sized, white dragon. Personality Abnormally docile and intelligent for a smaller white dragon.

item.title: Zilry
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Zilry An elf researcher who arrived in Phandalin along with Waybert to study the incoming Modron March. Description Appearance Personality Biography Key Info Relationships Waybert Spinzig Waybert is a companion who joins in Zilry’s study.

After the relative success last session stealthily clearing out the southeastern perimeter of the tower, the party initially follows a similar tactic: luring guards in small groups into the library to be dispatched quietly. Things go well at first. Then Val suddenly leaves the party to chat up a dragon, and when the group tries to follow, Zed gets the attention of a guardian hellhound, which alerts some of the more powerful devils in the tower.

item.title: Magnanimy
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Magnanimy A regular patron of the The Brimstone, who seems to traffic in information. Description Looks to be a tiefling-ish, higher-class gentleman. Biography Key Info Magnanimy is fond of gambling.

Oneshoe took point leading the party as they explored the first set of rooms along the perimeter of the tower going from Southwest corner counterclockwise towards the East. They find some torture victims and survive the activation of a devious torture chamber themselves. One of the party’s targets has been found. No sign of Magrin yet.

Another day at court for Horns’ trial. This time, the prosecution calls Val to the stand. This does not go well for Horns. Later, the party learns that Horns has been secretly hoarding a large stash of soul coins since Avernus. In the midst of intraparty conflict and high tempers, the party attempts to finalize the plan for the Caper at Fierna’s Tower, but they ultimately opt to cut that short and do it live. Teleporting to one of the locations given by Aeortis, the party begins their mission on the 42nd floor.

Rinn’thalas learns about cake. Ignaroz meets the party to discuss the upcoming Caper at Fierna’s Tower. Rinn leads a few members of the party in some late-night teambuilding through larceny. The party continues their group therapy session during the next day of court proceedings.

After spending some time with the stone giant Keith Stone, the party continues gathering intel for their Caper at Fierna’s Tower. They speak with Melkor and later Aeortis, who gives them detailed information about the tower’s construction in exchange for a new contract to retrieve something extra from the tower. A letter is delivered to the party by a strange messenger.

item.title: Tymphal's Contract
item.description: CONTRACTED WORK AGREEMENT This Contracted Work Agreement (the ‚ÄúAgreement‚Äù) is entered into by and between TYMPHAL (the ‚ÄúClient‚Äù) and , (the ‚ÄúMortals‚Äù), collectively ‚Äúthe Parties.‚Äù THEREFORE, the Parties agree as follows:

After much deliberation, the party reluctantly signs a modified form of Tymphal’s Contract in order to engage Carmen’s services. Horns also receives a surprise visit from an old companion which had been kept secret from the party until now.

item.title: Ocean's Oneshoe
item.description: Zed receives news of the Feywild from an old friend before he is later served up as part of a “cake” buffet delivery to Carmen. The party is approached with an offer of work to pay off Carmen’s hefty fee to defend Horns, but it requires making another deal with a devil.

item.title: curious forge and the station investigation

item.title: legs for days
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore Invisible and in giant ape form, Horns sprinted down the hall, away from the closed door to the room with the remorhaz, and turned into a room on his right that housed a flight of stairs leading up to the next deck.

item.title: snails on a plane
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore

item.title: Vrock 'n' Roll
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore The Menagerie took some time to sort their shit out and figure out what they wanted to do and how they wanted to proceed now that the group was feeling like themselves again.

item.title: lose yourself
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore Horns flew towards the site of the battle between Zariel, Archduke of Avernus, and Graz’zt, Lord of Azzatar, but didn’t enter the melee.

item.title: a curse, a kiss; gifts from the abyss
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore Nearly all of the Menagerie had returned to the Anti-Chrysler, save for Horns and the now-enfeebled Gray.

item.title: how to not win friends and influence sibriexes
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore The imp Balakros conjured a small chair and lounged upon the middle platform near the jackal-fiend, and the Menagerie approached the tortuous structure.

item.title: for whom Bel tolls
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore The Menagerie were back in Avernus, and though they spent a few hours in the Feywild, it seemed like no time had passed for Baator.

item.title: gourd of wrath
item.description: Scaena et Tempore The nalfeshnee appeared on the back of the demon grinder, immediately menacing Horns (who was still in air elemental form). The Menagerie brought a world of hurt down upon the demon, prompting the nalfeshnee to call down and consume some of the surrounding airborne chasme to undo some of the wounds it had sustained.

item.title: demons in the headlights
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore With their immediate threat having been dealt with, and with a moment to catch their collective breath, The Menagerie came together upon the Anti-Chrysler to have an argument a discussion about what to do next, and why.

item.title: the great escape(s)
item.description: Warning: this post may contain spoilers for the “Baldur’s Gate: Descent Into Avernus” 5e module. Scaena et Tempore With Gimble’s absence weighing upon them and having not much better to do than to press onward, The Menagerie gathered themselves and their warmachines together.

item.title: catch-22 items
item.description: The Menagerie make several purchases from Grundle & Chode’s Arcane Boutique, including a retainer for druids who like talking while wild-shaped. Gimble reaches a breaking point and leaves the party.

item.title: Asmodeus
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography The Lord of the Nine, the Father of Lies ‚Äî Asmodeus is the archdevil above all archdevils. He rules the Nine Hells of Baator from the ninth layer, Nessus.

item.title: Aunt Lyra
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography Gimble’s roving aunt! Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Grundle & Chode
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography A pair of goblins who run a planeskipping arcane oddities shop (Grundle does all the talking). They have a deal with Asmodeus that allows them free passage through Avernus (first layer of the Nine Hells of Baator), and have also said that they visit Waterdeep in the autumn.

item.title: Mechanus
item.description: Map Key Info A lawful neutral plane full of unfathomably-large clockworks, Mechanus is home to the modrons and overseen by Primus.

item.title: Primus
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography The overseer of the plane of Mechanus. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: collecting blood for fun and profit
item.description: Horns grows a pair of wings, and Cassandra agrees to help the party in exchange for the bag of devouring. A tortle named Krull escorts the Menagerie from Arkhan’s tower to Arkhan himself. They negotiate a trade of the orb of dragonkind for a vial of Tiamat’s blood and Val backs down from dueling Arkhan. Uldrak’s empyrean form is restored, and on the way back to the Demon Zapper the party stops at a conveniently-relocated Wandering Emporium to shelter from an acid storm.

item.title: Hawthorne MacDarmott
item.description: Description Appearance A male chromatic dragonborn, constantly shifting between the chromatic colors. Personality Biography He was once the mayor of shadow-Leilon and a herald of Tiamat, until the Menagerie slew him and Val took his jawbone and flaming greatsword.

item.title: Krull
item.description: Description Appearance A male tortle. Image property of Wizards of the Coast LLC. Personality Biography Follower of Arkhan the Cruel and gatekeeper of Arkhan’s tower on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator.

item.title: Torogar Steelfist
item.description: Description Appearance Image property of Wizards of the Coast LLC. Personality Biography One of Arkhan’s generals on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: of motorcycles and newtonian physics
item.description: The Menagerie approach Arkhan’s tower and, upon seeing it guarded by a dragon, decide to recuperate and gather their strength instead of rushing in. Gimble casts identify on the orb of dragonkind. Gray is paid a visit by the Raven Queen who delivers an intercepted letter and a warning against the Feywild. A devilish warband starts a fight, and the party makes a new drow acquaintance.

item.title: Candlekeep
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Cassandra Belacourt
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Cassandra Belacourt Agent of The Reclamation – a party which seeks to reclaim artifacts that should not be out in the wild. Description Appearance A female drow.

item.title: The Raven Queen
item.description: Description Appearance Unknown, but most commonly she appears as a floating porcelain mask. Personality Biography A goddess of death and lost souls. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: stack.push(quest)
item.description: Red Ruth tells the party that Ralzala can be freed by drinking the blood of a titan, and conveniently also divulges the location of a titan named Uldrak. The Menagerie names their infernal warmachine “the Anti-Chrysler” and goes to pay Uldrak a visit, but they’re diverted yet again by the need to restore his titan form. They set course for Arkhan’s tower, and are attacked by vrocks along the way.

item.title: Arkhan
item.description: Description A male red chromatic dragonborn. Image property of Wizards of the Coast LLC. Appearance Personality Biography A devout follower of Tiamat, he maintains a tower on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator.

item.title: Arkhan's Tower
item.description: Map Key Info An obelisk capped with five large spikes, defended by obsidian ramparts and several patrolling dragons. Location Avernus, in the Nine Hells of Baator. Residents Arkhan the Cruel

item.title: Tiamat
item.description: Description Appearance A gargantuan five-headed dragon, each head being one of the five types of chromatic dragons. Personality Biography The (evil) Queen of (chromatic) Dragons, Tiamat is imprisoned somewhere on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator.

item.title: Uldrak
item.description: Description Appearance Image property of Wizards of the Coast LLC. Personality Biography The empyrean Uldrak quested into the Nine Hells to slay Tiamat and win glory for his deity, Surtur, but he was beaten handily by the dragon queen.

item.title: friendly fire
item.description: The Menagerie set up camp in Red Ruth’s yard to house-sit while she’s away. In the middle of resting, they’re attacked by banshees and a treant! Gimble learns a little about arcane edge cases, Not-Bailey dies for a moment, Horns becomes a fire elemental, and Finn feeds the treant to a bag.

item.title: avernian errands
item.description: The Menagerie meet Red Ruth and she tells them her price for the information about Ralzala that they want. They Tokyo-drift through the lava geysers of the fire plains and arrive at the Wandering Emporium to book Red Ruth’s spa visit. While at the Wandering Emporium, Horns has a beer and the crew do a small amount of shopping before racing back across the fire plains to house-sit for Red Ruth while she takes herself out for a spa day.

item.title: Fort Knucklebone
item.description: Map Key Info A fortified outpost on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator. Ruled by Mad Maggie

item.title: Mad Maggie
item.description: Description A female night hag. Appearance Personality Biography Head honcho of Fort Knucklebones, a fortified outpost on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Mahadi
item.description: Description A male rakshasa. Appearance Personality Biography Owner of the Wandering Emporium (commonly found somewhere on the layer Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator), and proprietor of Infernal Rapture.

item.title: The Wandering Emporium
item.description: Key Info ‚ÄúAll are welcome here. No fighting! No spellcasting! No exceptions!‚Äù ‚Äï sign at the entrance of the Wandering Emporium Owner Mahadi is the master of the Wandering Emporium and proprietor of the Infernal Rapture.

item.title: Bel
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography Unwilling advisor and second-in-command to Zariel on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: hashtag not all bags
item.description: Lulu remembers some locations that may help the party find Zariel’s ring, and the group travels to a weapon known as the Demon Zapper. They meet Ralzala, a dao who guards the Demon Zapper, and undertake a quest to find Red Ruth in the Bone Brambles for information on Ralzala’s behalf. Oneshoe almost gets eaten by a malevolent purse.

item.title: Ralzala
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography A dao who was responsible for guarding the Demon Zapper on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: Red Ruth
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography A hag who lives in the Bone Brambles, a region in Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: The Bone Brambles
item.description: Map Key Info A region of Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells of Baator. Home of the hag Red Ruth.

item.title: "zed's folly"
item.description: The consequences of Horns’ and Zed’s actions result in a confrontation against an opponent capable of dropping Zed. The Menagerie save Lulu from being hollyphantnapped by a hellwasp.

item.title: Avernus
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Cania
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Dis
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Haruman
item.description: Description A narzugon that the Menagerie encountered in Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells of Baator. Appearance Personality Biography He had been one of Zariel’s generals in the time before her fall, and when her host crashed and broke upon the infernal legions, Haruman took it upon himself to deliver judgement upon those of the host who deserted the cause.

item.title: Lulu
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography A tiny hollyphant that the party met while on Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator who once was a longtime friend and ally to Zariel before her fall.

item.title: Maladomini
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Malbolge
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Minauros
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Nessus
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Phlegethos
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: Stygia
item.description: Map Key Info

item.title: The Nine Hells of Baator
item.description: Map Key Info A lawful evil plane containing nine separate layers of torment: Avernus Dis Minauros Phlegethos Stygia Malbolge Maladomini Cania Nessus

item.title: Zariel
item.description: Description Appearance Personality Biography The archduchess of Avernus, first layer of the Nine Hells of Baator. Key Info Relationships Quotations Trivia

item.title: spring cleaning my digital identity
item.description: I’d been reading up about git-secret and realized that I didn’t really grasp what a PGP key is or how to use one (or more). I’ve had a Keybase account since 2011, and it’s become a bit of a disjointed mess.

item.title: the dns and deployment of tlake.io
item.description: Porkbun is my new favorite domain registrar and had the best deals on .io domains that I could find, but I wanted to use DNSimple to manage my DNS settings.

item.title: Six Months Later
item.description: Six Months Later (2018-10-05) Finding Jon Had left town about a month before we had arrived in Neverwinter. Neverwinter Thundertree Looking for Jon there. Pick up his trail towards Mt. Hotenoh.

item.title: Return to Phandalin
item.description: Return to Phandalin (2018-09-21) Quick Notes Sleeping Giant -> Raven’s Roost Phandalin Ale Echo Cave Val picked fight with a local and knocked them out. Stone Hill Inn Horns chatted with the innkeeper.

item.title: 43: Fomorian Forward Camp, Part 1
item.description: 43: Fomorian Forward Camp, Part 1 (2018-03-09) The Menagerie stands at the mouth of a large tunnel, its entrance a static eruption of earth and stone. The slope is not gradual, but also not steep enough to hinder movement.

item.title: 42: The Crimson Bulwark
item.description: 42: The Crimson Bulwark (2018-02-16)

item.title: 41: A Friend On The Inside
item.description: 41: A Friend On The Inside (2018-02-02)

item.title: 40: What Fever Dreams May Come
item.description: 40: What Fever Dreams May Come (2018-01-12)

item.title: 39: Unexpected Guests
item.description: 39: Unexpected Guests (2017-12-01)

item.title: 38: The Bookwyrm
item.description: 38: The Bookwyrm (2017-11-04) Some time after parting ways with Goblin Hood and his Little John, Haeltin’s nose picks up a rather familiar scent, and his ears detect footfalls. Before long, the orc Bruce catches up with them (with the goblin still on his shoulders) with a plea for their aid.

item.title: 37: Feywild 101
item.description: 37: Feywild 101 (2017-10-20) The dusky lavender of twilight is still painted across the sky of the Feywild as the Menagerie stirs from their rest after falling into this new plane.

item.title: Interlude: The Tomb of Gauntletvania
item.description: Interlude: The Tomb of Gauntletvania (2017-10-06)

item.title: 36: The Mission
item.description: 36: The Mission (2017-09-08) (Finn, Gimble, Hael, Horns, Ivor, Val) 20-21 Uktar 1491 DR? There is no sense of time within the portal, and after-images from everything the characters look at remain imprinted on their eyes.

item.title: 35: The Katabasis, Part 4
item.description: 35: The Katabasis, Part 4 (2017-08-25) (Finn, Hael, Horns, Ivor, Val) 20 Uktar 1491 DR The party’s front line rushes towards the platform at the bottom of the stairs, while Horns and Reidoth remain on a bridge above, calling down lightning on the devils.

item.title: 34: The Katabasis, Part 3
item.description: 34: The Katabasis, Part 3 (2017-08-18) (Finn, Gimble, Hael, Horns, Ivor, Val) 20 Uktar 1491 DR The party presses further downward into the volcanic heart of Mt. Hotenow, harried by devils every step of the way.

item.title: Interlude: Everyone Is Twentieth Level
item.description: Interlude: Everyone Is Twentieth Level (2017-07-20) Guest DM: Austin

item.title: 33: The Katabasis, Part 2
item.description: 33: The Katabasis, Part 2 (2017-07-11) (Finn, Gimble, Hael, Horns, Val) 20 Uktar 1491 DR The battle into the heart of the caldera of Mt. Hotenow continues! The party continues to fight down heavy black iron steps and across swaying chain bridges.

item.title: Interlude: The Sunless Citadel, Part 3
item.description: Interlude: The Sunless Citadel, Part 3 (2017-06-23) (Endymion, Lulubell, Ol’ One Shot, Reginald, Tinder) Guest DM: Jonathan

item.title: 32: The Katabasis, Part 1
item.description: 32: The Katabasis, Part 1 (2017-06-16) (Finn, Gimble, Gorstag, Hael, Horns, Val) 20 Uktar 1491 DR The Menagerie spends the night in the mouth of the lava tube that opens up onto the side of Mt.

item.title: 30: What's In A Name?
item.description: 31: What’s In A Name? (2017-06-02) (Finn, Gimble, Hael, Horns, Val) The party takes a couple of days in Neverwinter to obtain supplies and take care of some things before they make their journey into the Nine Hells of Baator:

item.title: 30: Thundertree: The Devil You Know, and Were Is Gray
item.description: 30: Thundertree: The Devil You Know, and Were Is Gray (2017-04-14) (Finn, Gimble, Gray, Horns, Zane) Reidoth has something very important to tell the party 30 years ago, the activity in Mt.

item.title: 29: Thundertree: Here There Be Dragon("Cultist")s
item.description: 29: Thundertree: Here There Be Dragon(“Cultist”)s (2017-03-31) (Gimble, Horns, Zane) Exploration of Thundertree Met Dragon Fanboys Defeated Venomfang

item.title: 28: Thundertree: Stay Awhile And Listen
item.description: 28: Thundertree: Stay Awhile And Listen (2017-03-17) (Finn, Gimble, Gorstag, Horns, Zane) Arrival at Thundertree

item.title: 27: Forests Are Better Than Open Roads
item.description: 27: Forests Are Better Than Open Roads (2017-03-03) (Gimble, Gorstag, Horns, Zane) 1 ankheg 5 ghasts

item.title: 26: Tut Tut, It Looks Like Rain
item.description: 26: Tut Tut, It Looks Like Rain (2017-02-17) (Finn, Gorstag, Horns, Orsik, Zane) Introduction of Orsik Stoneskin Introduction of Willoughby the Whether Gnome Water Weird at Old Owl Well

item.title: 25: Tresendar Manor: Cellar, Part 2
item.description: 25: Tresendar Manor: Cellar, Part 2 (2017-02-03) (Gimble, Horns, Mindartis, Zane) Poor Droop

item.title: 24: Tresendar Manor: Cellar, Part 1
item.description: 24: Tresendar Manor: Cellar, Part 1 (2017-01-20) (Finn, Gimble, Gorstag, Horns, Zane) Celestial Bailey ferries Gray off into the night unknown

item.title: 23: Battle at Tresendar Manor
item.description: 23: Battle at Tresendar Manor (2017-01-06) (Finn, Gimble, Horns, Ivor, Gray) Death of Gray Horns and Mindartis fight over capturing or killing Iarno Mindartis wins, and Iarno dies ““The sky is gray and tinged with regret.

item.title: 22: Gnomish "Diplomacy"
item.description: 22: Gnomish ““Diplomacy”” (2016-12-16) (Finn, Gimble, Gray, Ivor, Mindartis) The party sets out to deal with Glasstaff and the Redbrands at Tresendar Manor Glasstaff turns out to be Iarno Gimble uses ““Speak Without Thinking.

item.title: 21: Wave Echo Cave Revisited, Part 2
item.description: 21: Wave Echo Cave Revisited, Part 2 (2016-12-02) (Finn, Gimble, Gray, Horns, Ivor, Val) Encounter with Mormesk the Wraith Val uses speak with plants to threaten fungus into not casting spores (#AggressiveMycology) Encounter with the Black Pudding they didn’t kill last time

item.title: 20: Wave Echo Cave Revisited, Part 1
item.description: 20: Wave Echo Cave Revisited, Part 1 (2016-11-18) (Finn, Gimble, Gray, Horns, Val) Horns summons a flock of owls The Flaming Skull has regenerated! The Flaming Skill has been defeated again!

item.title: 19: Gettin' Prepped
item.description: 19: Gettin’ Prepped (2016-11-11) (Finn, Gimble, Gray, Horns, Ivor, Val) Acquisition of holy water from Sister Garaele

item.title: 18: Lord Ashewood's Party, Part 2
item.description: 18: Lord Ashewood’s Party, Part 2 (2016-11-04) (Finn, Gray, Horns, Ivor) Discovery of Lily upstairs Discovery of hidden door in library Ashewood’s dark regeneration and the subsequent battle Discovery of private room Discovery of magic items; destruction of horn of blasting

item.title: 17: Lord Ashewood's Party, Part 1
item.description: 17: Lord Ashewood’s Party, Part 1 (2016-10-28) (Finn, Gray, Horns, Ivor) Arrival in Neverwinter Shopping extravaganza Finn commissioned some custom armor for Not-Bailey from Melga Proudshield, a female dwarven smith Met Billy Wall of Billy Brandishes Met Alara, ~250 year old gnome who runs a curiosity shop Bought mystery potion on the cheap (““knowing costs extra””) Mixture of Diminution and Giant Strength Lord Ashewood’s Party, Pt I Guest list: Lord Darius Ashewood Lady Diana Ashewood Lily, their daughter (19) Butler Verne Servants Rian Trevin Lora Marin Lord Branden Blackthorne Lady Pramilla Blackthorne Jared, their son (24) Corin, a miller Lawrence, a merchant Billy Wall, of Billy Brandishes Philip, a librarian Jon, the decorated Guardsman Ballroom schmoozing Dinner gathering Death of Lord Ashewood Start of investigation

item.title: 16: In Memoriam: Bailey
item.description: 16: In Memoriam: Bailey (2016-10-14) (Finn, Gimble, Gorstag, Gray, Horns, Ivor, Val) Bailey’s Funeral The road to Neverwinter Lyra’s encounter with sprites

item.title: 15: Wave Echo Cave, Part 5
item.description: 15: Wave Echo Cave, Part 5 (2016-10-07) (Finn, Horns, Gray, Ivor) Flaming Skull Death of Bailey

item.title: 14: Wave Echo Cave, Part 4
item.description: 14: Wave Echo Cave, Part 4 (2016-09-30) (Finn, Gimble, Gray, Horns, Val) Horns learned about poisonous fungus Fought a bunch of ghouls Gray went unconscious and lost a hand to ghoul dinner Val spiderclimbed a wall and threw Finn at a ghoul, which exploded Bailey and Not Bailey both went unconscious Lots of paralysis happening Concerted effort of Val’s + Horns’ healing, potion from Gimble, and kazoo from Finn reattached Gray’s mangled hand… but to what effect?

item.title: 13: Wave Echo Cave, Part 3
item.description: 13: Wave Echo Cave, Part 3 (2016-09-23) (Finn, Gray, Horns, Val) Killed Nezznar Rescued Nundro and Gungren, buried Tharden Party awarded Boots of Springing and Striding Explored some more of the southern part of the cave Fought skeletons and ghouls (Finn used MM wand to great effect)

item.title: 12: Wave Echo Cave, Part 2
item.description: 12: Wave Echo Cave, Part 2 (2016-09-16) (Finn, Gimble, Gorstag, Gray, Horns, Mindartis, Val) Finn found Wand of Magic Missiles on skeleton of wizard in cavern lake Fought a Bugbear mining party, overseen by a Doppleganger Fought Nezznar & Bugbears & Giant Spiders Nezznar escaped Mindartis shenanigans Beeline for gems at combat start Flee gems when giant spiders show up Run into invisible Nezznar in hallway Shocking Grasped to unconsciousness by Nezznar Revived by Gimble Magic Missiled to unconsciousness by Nezznar

item.title: 11: Wave Echo Cave, Part 1
item.description: 11: Wave Echo Cave, Part 1 (2016-09-09) (Finn, Gimble, Gray, Horns, JSON, Mindartis, Val) Mephits emerge from magma pit Looking for the ““fire mage”” Gimble Horns’ unknown language is Ignan Horns is translator Gimble told them to ““Bless homes”” WEC (Wave Echo Cave) 1 Found Tharden’s body Gundren stays with Tharden Fought chamber of stirges Party spits in five ways Encountered Black Puddings Val’s javelin has permanent -1 corrosion Val’s armor has permanent -1 corrosion Horns’ armor has -1 permanent corrosion JSON the bard curses a pudding to death

item.title: 10: (Un)Living History
item.description: 10: (Un)Living History (2016-08-26) (Finn, Gimble, Gorstag, Horns, Ivor, Kithri, Mindartis, Val) Encountered necromancer at Old Owl Well Spent the night Gimble got a Ring of Prot +1 and a scroll of False Life Travel back to Phandalin Midnight discovery of magma pit where wildfire began

item.title: 09: What's Val's Alignment Again...?
item.description: 09: What’s Val’s Alignment Again…? (2016-08-19) (Finn, Gimble, Gray, Val) Random encounters on way south to Wyvern Tor Wyvern Tor Saved Val, saved Lyra Killed Orcs Val uses heat metal on an Orc, cooking the thing alive in its own armor Party converged on Old Owl Well

item.title: 08: A Date With A Banshee
item.description: 08: A Date With A Banshee (2016-08-05) (Finn, Gimble, Gorstag, Gray Horns) At Sister Garaele’s request, the party makes the journey northeast (through grasslands recently devastated by flame) to Conybery to gather information about the spellbook of a wizard named Bowgentle Met Trynna Briegarden in the abandoned town Party named her shower invention the ““douche”” Encountered the Banshee Agatha, and learned that Bowgentle’s spellbook had been traded to some necromancer a century ago

item.title: 07: With Great Power Comes Great Irresponsibility
item.description: 07: With Great Power Comes Great Irresponsibility (2016-07-29) Party rescues Gimble from the castle and beings the journey back to Phandalin Party defeats a wandering Ogre Nighttime ambush by a pack of marauding Gnolls A careless flaming sphere from Gimble starts a wildfire that sweeps northeast along the Triboar trail; the party runs from the fire for a day ““The sky is tinged with regret.

item.title: 06: The Assault on Cragmaw Castle
item.description: 06: The Assault on Cragmaw Castle (2016-07-15) Party mounts an offensive on the castle Defeat of King (Dave) Grol, and acquisition of Gundren’s map Party becomes trapped in the throne, but manages to escape - Gimble is left behind, though

item.title: 05: Cragmaw Castle: The Patented Colville Screw
item.description: 05: Cragmaw Castle: The Patented Colville Screw (2016-07-08) Party infiltrates the castle, masquerading as drunken Redbrands Val sneaks away to throne room, draws attention of King (Dave) Grol and a Doppleganger who appears to be a Drow Val fails at not blowing her cover: ““Uh… Where’s the bathroom?

item.title: 04: Cragmaw Hideout, Revisited
item.description: 04: Cragmaw Hideout, Revisited (2016-07-01) Encounter goblin patrol Capture of goblin Trek to Cragmaw Castle ““Why make food when you can take food?”” #LowIntLifeLessons Goblin leads party into Wight encounter in the forest Arrival at Cragmaw Castle"

item.title: 03: Cragmaw Hideout Part 2
item.description: 03: Cragmaw Hideout Part 2 (2016-06-24) Explore rest of cave Free Sildar Hallwinter Free the wolves chained near the entrance Finn convinces two of them to stay Bailey and Not-Bailey (Barnum) join the party Escort Sildar to Phandalin Tell Lionshield Coster about supplies in Cragmaw Hideout

item.title: 02: Cragmaw Hideout Part 1
item.description: 02: Cragmaw Hideout Part 1 (2016-06-17) Explore part of cave Defeat Klarg the Bugbear

item.title: 01: Introduction
item.description: 01: Introduction (2016-06-10) Discover horse bodies Journey to Phandalin Explore town Trek back to ambush site Trek to entrance of Cragmaw Hideout

item.title: The Calendar of Harptos
item.description: Information in this article is pulled from Sword Coast Adventurer’s Guide, pages 14-15. There are thirty days (three tendays, or “rides”) in each month and five annual holidays that fall between months that make up a year of 365 days on the world of Toril.

item.title: OG Landing Page
item.description: import campaign “The sky is gray and tinged with regret.” import campaign is a Seattle-based fifth-edition Dungeons & Dragons campaign run by a Python developer for several other Python developers (…plus a couple folks who aren’t).

item.title: Phandalin
item.description: Phandalin was a mainly human village in the Sword Coast North. It was raided by orcs in 951 DR and subsequently abandoned. It was eventually resettled in the late 15th century DR as a frontier settlement of farmers and prospectors.

item.title: Dilemma at the Aboleth's Lair
item.description: Gimble the Diviner Dilemma at the Aboleth’s Lair In Shadow Leilon, Gimble was finally able to locate his missing sister and aunt in the depths of the aboleth’s lair in 2019-08-09 Import Campaign.

item.title: Finn
item.description: Halfling Barbarian (D&D Beyond) the ‚Äúconjurer‚Äù #LowIntLifeLessons friend to Not-Bailey don‚Äôt ask about Bailey Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships Character Information Quotations Trivia References

item.title: Gimble Became Lawful Evil in Avernus
item.description: Gimble the Diviner Gimble Became Lawful Evil in Avernus After being dragged to Hell (literally) by the party, Gimble eventually succumbed to the pernicious nature of Avernus and shifted to a lawful evil outlook.

item.title: Gimble prepares special defensive magic for Finn
item.description: Gimble the Diviner Gimble prepares special defensive magic for Finn When Gimble Became Lawful Evil in Avernus, he new he had to leave the Hells. However, his lingering friendship with Finn compelled him to first make some special castings into his Ioun stone and give it to Finn, hoping it would help keep her safe.

item.title: Gimble the Diviner
item.description: Gimble the Diviner gnome wizard (D&D Beyond) ‚Äúthe diviner‚Äù moral compass always flustered family matters Description Appearance Gimble is a rock gnome standing just over three feet tall. He has blue eyes and chestnut hair which tends to be a frazzled mess, spiking upwards.

item.title: Gimble the Diviner Backstory
item.description: Gimble the Diviner Gimble the Diviner Backstory Formatted Gimble the Diviner Backstory – Formatted Text Version Gimble seeks to unravel the mystery of a strange, blank book and its connection to his lost sister.

item.title: Gorstag
item.description: Gorstag human fighter (D&D Beyond) trans-dimensional gambling baron rolls with anything occasional corrective community service portal technology: unknown Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships Character Information Quotations Trivia References

item.title: Grale
item.description: Grale half-orc monk/ranger (D&D Beyond) like, three Narutos, and also a Goku shadow run (but not like the rpg) stuns for days biggus stickus Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships Character Information Quotations Trivia References

item.title: Haeltin Var Astora
item.description: Haeltin Var Astora half-drow blood hunter (D&D Beyond) goes by “Gray” formerly Haeltin Var Astora formerly a paladin formerly deceased anime werewolf motorcycle boi Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships Character Information Alter egos Jared Gray took on the persona of “Jared” several times in the Sword Coast.

item.title: Horns
item.description: Horns tiefling druid (D&D Beyond) knows trees’ weak points formerly a general in the Blood War probably not evil - like, probably new and improved, now with wings! Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships Character Information Quotations Trivia References

item.title: Ivor Borst
item.description: Ivor Borst human barbarian no door is safe Loviatar - wait, WHAT Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships Character Information Quotations Trivia References

item.title: Mirna Dendrar
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Mirna Dendrar Description Human commoner from Phandalin Biography When she was a young girl, she and her family fled from the town of Thundertree after undead overran the place.

item.title: Nezznar, The Black Spider
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Nezznar, The Black Spider Description drow wizard (deceased) Biography Key Info defeated by the party in The Wave Echo Cave Relationships Quotations Trivia source of Gimble’s Spider Staff

item.title: Nundro Rockseeker
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Nundro Rockseeker Nundro Rockseeker was one of the three dwarf brothers who rediscovered Wave Echo Cave. Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships younger brother to Gundren Rockseeker younger brother to Tharden Rockseeker Key Info slain in The Wave Echo Cave by forces of The Black Spider Quotations Trivia References

item.title: Oneshoe
item.description: Oneshoe Gnome Rogue/Warlock (D&D Beyond) professional detective business owner don‚Äôt ask about the other shoe goddammit Harold Description Appearance Oneshoe is a rock gnome. Her brown hair is cut with asymmetrical bangs, which helps to hide some burn scars on the left side of her face.

item.description: Orsik Stoneskin dwarf monk is he still at Old Owl Well? Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships Character Information Quotations Trivia References

item.title: Reidoth
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Reidoth Description Reidoth is a gaunt, white-bearded human who doesn’t use two words when one word will do. Though he receives very few visitors, he is reasonably hospitable.

item.title: Rinn'thalas Liadon
item.description: Rinn’thalas Liadon Wood Elf Horizon Walker Ranger DND Beyond Description Appearance Personality Biography Background With Menagerie in Baator Relationships Ze’brak Gorstag Character Info Quests Deliver a letter to the party (a favor for Gorstag orchestrated by Gimble) Find his lost friend, Ze’brak Notable Items Quotations Trivia

item.title: Sildar Hallwinter
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Sildar Hallwinter Human soldier and member of the Lords’ Alliance who accompanies Gundren Rockseeker on travel from Neverwinter to Phandalin. Description Appearance Personality Seemed sincere in his desire to help the townsfolk of Phandalin.

item.title: Sister Garaele
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Sister Garaele Description Elf cleric of Tymora who tends the Luck Shrine in town. Biography Key Info member of The Harpers sent party on a quest to get information from a banshee named Agatha about the location of Bowgentle’s spellbook Relationships Gimble Taught Gimble the ritual for Gentle Repose Quotations Trivia

item.title: Tharden Rockseeker
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Tharden Rockseeker Tharden Rockseeker was one of the three dwarf brothers who rediscovered Wave Echo Cave. Description Appearance Personality Biography Relationships older brother to Gundren Rockseeker older brother to Nundro Rockseeker Key Info The dwarf was slain by forces under the command of Nezznar, The Black Spider.

item.title: That time Val tried to murder Gimble
item.description: Gimble the Diviner That time Val tried to murder Gimble When the party became 5th level, Gimble had a premonition that he would very soon need the ability to fly. Obsessed with this, he absentmindedly plucked a feather from Val’s new Giant Owl form for a spell component to aid in his furious study.

item.title: The Tinkerer
item.description: Import Campaign Characters Harold Peters You know, the Tinkerer. Description Appearance Personality Biography Originally from the Sword Coast, Harold Peters (you know, the Tinkerer) somehow found himself lost in Shadow Leilon.

item.title: Val
item.description: Val wood elf druid (D&D Beyond) never surprised flexible morality a real dwarf‚Äôs elf some kind of royalty Description Appearance Personality Biography Born as Nadyantal’laval Has a brother, Elirion’tar. Apparently, Val has other siblings, including an eldest brother.
